title: So what do you guys wanna do with Taric? PART II. Pics or it didn't happen!
body:
Hey guys,

So that other Taric thread is an amazing gold mine (or should I say GEM MINE! AHH? GET IT? Anyways..) of ideas and suggestions. The sentiments and discussions are absolutely fascinating and extremely helpful. I'm always floored by how insightful and thoughtful, you, our players are, and how in depth you go. You have no idea how valuable that insight is.

What I'd like to ask for here is reference. As artists we constantly look at reference imagery for a number of reasons. Sometimes it's to look at anatomy, to make sure we're creating a body correctly. Other times it's for light or color, so we can see how a scheme will serve an illustration. In this case however, I'm looking for design reference. 

What does that mean? Armor! Gems! Motifs! Flourishes! Portraits! Anything that could be pointed to and said "Hey, I think Taric could incorporate elements from this!", or, "This image really hits me in the feels, those are the sort of feels I want to feel when I look at Taric." 

So while the last thread (which is still going strong, please continue to post in there) there was a lot of visual suggestions, explanations in written format sorta dominated. That's totally fine. Here I'd love to see you throw some images at me! 

Thanks!

replies.body: Honestly expecting some incredibly majestic hair. I want his splash art to be reminiscent of Romantic novel covers.
Opinion on the open chest? ;)
If it were up to me, Tarics chiseled chest would be the envy of summoners rift, but thats just me.
Honestly it's a legit discussion! Is that something that helps or diminishes? Is it too "on the nose" flamboyant or is it a sign of a well-groomed and fashionable individual? What are your thoughts?

Please throw the dude-liking crowd a bone. We can't make do with Pool Party Graves, Ruthless Pantheon and Varus when there's seventeen gazillion examples of gratuitous cleavage and scantly-clad women. It seriously shouldn't even be a question. The Lee Sin splash art was an example of a missed opportunity, since it could've been a way to show a hot shirtless dude and instead the pose obscures most of his torso and doesn't even have the decency of giving even a bit of ass in return. :(

This! Although I'm not a fan of the bulky, muscled type, I can understand that Taric would be a bulky, muscled type of guy. But just in the future... Give us dude-likers something to look at. (And variety, anyone?) Off topic, so I'll get back on topic soon. >>
(It's a fair point that more sexy men would be nice to have. The question here is if Taric is the right choice to be one, and which direction of sexy man he should/could be in.)

I'm going to reference another thread in this discussion to answer this. Just an opinion, of course.

[Models of Sexy Taric](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/a7ulBkBM-so-what-do-you-guys-wanna-do-with-taric-part-ii-pics-or-it-didnt-happen?comment=0014)

In this, the poster showed what Taric would look like in real life. 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/api/embedly/1/image/resize?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbookishtemptations.files.wordpress.com%2F2013%2F04%2F20130422-132045.jpg&key=a45e967db0914c7fb472fd4381e6c85b&width=150 This is a very good way to show off Taric's potential "sexiness" without overdoing. Put it in the face. Kinda like with Ezreal, but... Very different appeals. 

I feel like Taric is a champion that, if he were to be the "sexy one", it would be subdued slightly. He wouldn't show it off blatantly, but he might just put a few reminders out there of how pretty he/his gems are. My reasoning falls into his current image: he has a smooth, silky (creepy, if you ask me) voice, the potential for a pretty face in his artwork, but he doesn't let this show. He talks about his gems a lot, as he seems to be proud of it, so he's subtly showing these things about himself off.

I think Taric should be gallant and charming, not sexy. 

By sexy meaning show off or seductive, kinda like MF is. 

He can remain attractive, but trying to make him sexy can backfire on the character. Most men who are sexy dont try or force it, they just are.

If any man on the rift should be sexy its Taric. I personally love the Fabio, open shirt, flowing hair them. Taric is the hot guy riding a white horse down on the beach. The guy that be you male, female or otherwise will sweep you off your feet. Not just because he's gorgeous but because he's such a damned sweet person. 

To me, Taric thematically is INVITING. No matter who you are, Taric is inviting to you. And there's a number of reasons for it. His handsome face and gorgeous hair, the sound of his voice, his kind words, his battle prowess, his ripped body, all of that. Taric should be the "heart throb" of League. 

He's the type of individual you look up to and admire and just want to connect with. For those of us that are old enough to have experienced many different personality types, we've all known that person before. That was just magnetic! 

As far as the sexuality thing goes, in a few short months it's gonna be 2015. A gay character can just BE a gay character. Many other games have gay, lesbian, bi and trans characters in their roster and they're loved nonetheless. There's no need to just "imply" it to keep from getting any backlash. As to whether it adds to or diminishes the value of the character by aligning him directly, I think is an invalid question. The real question is how does it add to or diminish the views of Riot Games as a company on the issue of sexual expression. And that's a question that needs to be answered in-house. 

I think it'd be a great opportunity to say hey, this character is gay, slightly flamboyant and an absolute BADASS on the battle field. You want to play him. You NEED to play him!
Could be toned and tight? I don't think taric is the wrong choice for female fan service. That super unobtainable dream.

I also think that it's going to be hard to decide if making him sexy is a good choice because of the pool of people you're asking. Asking mostly young, straight male gamers what they think a sexy or attractive male should look like probably isn't going to net you the most accurate answer. Some guys will be quick to tell you how inappropriate Taric baring his chest is but will have nothing to say about MF's ample cleavage. And as a woman I can assure you that straight men never know what women are actually attracted to. My boyfriend still doesn't know why I find him attractive. lol Just make sure you formulate your opinions from a wide array of individuals. I personally would love some gender equality in sexiness on the Rift. And Pool Party Graves wasn't it. If he had been in a speedo, then we'd be talkin. lol

[Something like Loras Tyrell from Game of Thrones.](http://images6.fanpop.com/image/photos/34100000/loras-tyrell-house-tyrell-34178746-954-719.jpg)

But a little more buff and.. gems..

OK! GUNNA FANBOY A BIT! I really, REALLY love LT as a reference for Taric in a lot of ways. Beauty and poise being BIG main reads for him personally and aesthetically. 

Are others keen on this being a potential flag to rally around? Just curious. This is TOTALLY my opinion, just wondering if it resonates.

I don't like that as a reference. I don't watch GoT, but that image says "arrogant Frenchman" to me. That's not how I see Taric at all. I also don't see him as having any sort of exaggerated foppishness or Baroque-like accoutrements. There's a crucial difference between "simple person who cares for their appearance in a humble manner" and "pompous, frivolous snob". I feel Taric is the former rather than the latter.

I should clarify, I'm looking beyond the image into the context of this guy from the series. I can totally see that on its surface this convey's arrogant. I actually dig the notes inside the story he has of beauty, nobility, chivalry, and a lot of other Lancelot-esque sort of things. Sorry to make it seem like I'm reacting to the image alone.

Ah, my bad. I don't really see Taric as a chivalrous or noble person either. There is this whole thing about tradition and ceremony involved in chivalry and nobility, and that's not what I associate with Taric. Taric is just kind, he's not especially ceremonious about it. He doesn't make a grand gesture out of what he does for others or adhere to ceremony for the sake of it. His gentleness comes from a genuine caring heart, not from a noble upbringing.

Chivalry and noble gestures are social acts, and they are chiefly meant to impress and charm. Taric doesn't need to do that. He doesn't charm, he *is* charming on his own. It's in the simplicity of his gestures where the appeal lies, not on the elaborate traditions or ceremonies. Chivalry has a kind of theatricality built in it, where a sort of performance is put on display. Everyone knows the rules, what is expected, how to respond to this or that gesture, what to do in this or that event, and it's all so very constructed. Taric doesn't perform: he is transparent, what he does comes from the heart.

Sounds like your walking near Braum's personality here. 

Taric love to watch shiny Gems do Shiny things this might be charming and cute as it is.

True, Braum isn't chivalrous either and he is also a simple man who does things that come from the heart, but their personalities are very different. Braum is loud where Taric is quiet, boisterous where Taric is modest, brash where Taric is thoughtful, and over the top jolly where Taric is serene.

Taric's love of gems isn't a 100% aesthetic thing. Sure, Taric loves how gems look, but he also loves them for their power and significance. 4 of his 16 dialogue lines (a full 25% of them) are about what each gem is for. He has an educated understanding of what gems do, it's not like he likes them just because they're shiny.

I totally agree, even with some Renly things (books characters, no TV series)

But my fear is that this keeps him as the homo-joke he is at the moment. Like it happened with Loras in the series :/

Honestly, the best way to remedy this (in my opinion) would be to include other LGBTQA characters who distinctly *aren't* stereotypical at all. Vi can be the sitcom-esque butch lesbian, but what if Janna happened to swing the other way as well? Jinx is perhaps too easily labeled as bi, but what if that was also true of Alistar? League's champions are diverse enough to allow little tidbits like this without really ruining or challenging much of anything, with a nice spectrum of expressions/identities/preferences/etc.

Then again, this would have to be a lore thing, and that's a bit touchy right now.

Gonna go off on a tangent since you brought this up: in my opinion, there are only a handful of ways that Riot can make a MOGII/GSM/LHBTQA+ (my preferred term is GSM, although that has a rough past, but it's the simplest and most efficient of the three) character without making it blatantly obvious.

First of all, they never specify sexualities for the vast majority of characters. Even for the sexual-type characters like Ahri, it's never said who she preys on. For all we know, she could prey on anyone, female, male, alien, human. Vi could be a lesbian, Janna could be bi, Ezreal could be pan, and who knows, maybe someone like Shaco or Mundo is trans. The point is, these are all headcanons, they're never explicitly stated. 

I think Riot did this intentionally, and I both agree and disagree with it. Agree because it allows us to interpret their sexualities however we wish to, disagree because the community can make it seem like "everyone's straight, everyone's 'normal', there is no one queer here". It's a weird subject. Opinions?

As long as we're playing the Game of Thrones, you've got the wrong guy.  Taric is clearly Rhaegar Targaryen.  Just look at this fabulousness:

http://imgur.com/eMemoLR

Functional, yet stylish.  Probably I want more emphasis on gems on Taric than this -- say a rounded one on the back of his hand and some more clearly defined rubies in his breastplate.  Still, directionally this art feels very Taric to me.

Pretend I'm not a Rioter for now (and if you can't, then remember that this is just o p i n i o n s!)!

To me, Taric is a heavily armoured gent, but one that isn't afraid to squeeze as much adornment out of it as possible. Functional and stylish. Iron Stylish? I digress. 

I consider the two attached images to deliver well upon this, utilizing shapes and/or color to bring as much design language in as possible. The chunky shapes in the FFXIV image (Paladin) read very strongly to me, but I wouldn't be afraid of the going more towards the Dark Souls 2 direction for his joints and midsection for ease of moment. 

Of course, gems are a major factor for Taric. Specifically gems. Right now, he has a crystal motif, which communicates a very wild and raw nature. With the tepid manner of speech that he has right now, Taric feels much more refined to me. To that effect, I feel that faceted gems communicate this much more clearly. In addition, the facets would allow him to dazzle even brighter. Functional, and stylish.

As a final point, I feel that the crystal sword in the bottom right of the FFXIV image is cool to me. The entire weapon being forged of precious stone, using inlaid metals as reinforcement and support? pcool. I'd love to see his hammer and/or shield move in this direction.

I agree with everything here! Except for the sword bit to me. Swords feel too aggressive, to offensive to me. It's similar to Braum -- you didn't want to give him a weapon because it didn't fit his idea. For Taric, a sword wouldn't make sense to me because of how he acts -- he is a support first, perhaps a tank second. He is there for his friends. Not there to kill his enemies. The mace feels better because it is blunter (literally and metaphorically). It isn't going to slice someone up, you can use it to tap them, push them over, bash their skull in, etc. However, I can't recall if this is in his ult animation, but how he smashes his hammer for his ult is very, very important for me. He uses his gems to radiate their power. The hammer is where it "breaks free". 

Everything else I agree with completely. You said what I wanted to say, but in better words. 

(Also: everyone's opinion here is just that. So feel free to disagree/chime in. At least, that's my POV. It's a discussion, after all!)

Oh, I didn't mean to imply I wanted the sword. I 100% agree that a sword would be out of place. But a giant hammer/shield made of something like that? Totally.

I feel that Taric does currently play more aggressive (but not to the level of Leona), but that he is still a defensive character at his core.

Potentially fun side conversation: Which do you feel is more important to Taric: his hammer, or his shield?

(On my computer now, so responding will be much easier.)

Okay, so everything you said I completely agree with. :D

For the side conversation, I feel like his hammer is more important to him. Like you said, he does play more aggressive, but also merely in his current artistic design, the Shield feels like an addition. His hammer is where his power stems from, and he never uses his shield to protect others or himself, like Leona or Braum does. (Leona's Eclipse is what I think of as her "shield".) He uses the powers of his gems to protect himself and his allies.

How does a world where Taric doesn't have a shield look to you? What if Taric was changed to be a more defensive style of character?

I like hypothetical questions. I'm the bane of concept artists.

I like them too! I love to play Devil's Advocate.

In a world where Taric doesn't have his shield? It would feel... Definitely emptier. Taric's shield is the less important of the two, but it still is important in defining his character. The shield is a background object, but it exists to say, "Hey, I'm a defender, not an attacker," without shouting it out.

If Taric was changed? I could get behind that if it was done right. In gameplay sense, I would assume this would reflect on a more supportive style of play, not just a tanky playstyle. I feel like the overall image of Taric would be pretty different, but if you kept the gems, and maybe just made the hammer smaller, then it could potentially work. The shield would have to be redone, though.

But keep his cape. His cape is the best part about him at the moment.

http://i.imgur.com/YqFx59u.gif

Obvious gifs aside, capes aren't the easiest thing with League's camera angle. They eat up a large majority of character real estate from the rear, so a lot of cool details could be lost. 

Lending a hand to the Parrot, can you think of any instances were capes are meshed well with armor? Do you know of any references that utilize gems on a cape?

Give him at least half a cape! Since you linked the Paladin, I'll respond with the Infantry Shirt.

Taric needs something that flows with grace whenever he happens to catch a dramatic wind. A halfcape, scarf, or sash achieves that nicely.

It looks... weird. He should have his protective nature portrayed in some way. I mean, he appreciates beauty and life in others just as much as he seeks to emulate those values himself. Of course he's going to be a protector. If he doesn't have a shield, then what visual indicator is there of this facet (heh) of his nature?

Huh. I like that idea a lot. I got that he's a defensive character and that he has a love for beauty, but the thought that he loves life because it's a beautiful thing seems neat. 

Thanks for the response!

When I think of Taric, I'm thinking of a handsome man who wears a face that's shows obvious hardships.  Brad Pitt, Siegfried Schtauffen (Soul Calibur Franchise), the Wizard from Dragon's Crown.  

As another player pointed out, Taric is the Gem Knight.  Gems are formed under pressure.  Taric should show that pressure somewhere, most likely his face since I'm assuming that will still be visible.  Taric should show that pressure in the way he carries himself as well, the way he moves, the way he stands, the way he talks.  Taric is a warrior, a soldier.  He's seen the effects of war and the battlefield and yet he still appreciates the beauty in simple things (gems).  

I can imagine Taric taking a moment after surveying a battlefield to appreciate a flower growing against the grey background.  There's a maturity in there.  He hates war but he knows it's something he has to do.  He's a smiling man with a gentle demeanor but the weight of his experiences show clearly against his face.

Bi/gay dude here, and I really don't want Taric to be gay, because it completely undermines his type of masculinity by preying on people's associations of gay men and femininity. Instead of sending the message "straight dudes can be gentle and metrosexual and that's just as valid as some aggressive macho type like Tryndamere", they are further reinforcing the (false) stereotype that gay men are naturally feminine and that men with non-traditional masculinity are usually gay.

What I'd like to see would be the simultaneous reveal (in lore) that Taric is in a relationship with a woman (doesn't necessarily have to be a champion) and that another, stereotypically manly champion (like Pantheon) is in a relationship with a man. Then bam, presto, we have two progressive messages: gay guys can be aggressively manly and straight men can have a more gentle type of masculinity.
